DrugInfoMetaData.DrugInfoDescription: Dostarlimab-gxly is a type of drug called an immune checkpoint inhibitor (a type of immunotherapy). It is a monoclonal antibody that binds to the protein PD-1 on the surface of immune cells called T cells. It works by keeping cancer cells from suppressing the immune system. This allows the immune system to attack and kill the cancer cells.
DrugInfoMetaData.FDAExternalRef: FDA label information for this drug is available at DailyMed.

Para.ExternalRef: FDA label information for this drug is available at DailyMed.

Section.Title: Use in Cancer
Section.Para: Dostarlimab-gxly is approved to treat adults with:

ItemizedList.ListItem: endometrial cancer that has spread outside the uterus or come back. It is used:with carboplatin and paclitaxel and then alonealone in patients whose cancer is mismatch repair deficient (dMMR) and got worse during or after treatment with platinum-based chemotherapy
solid tumors that are dMMR, have spread or come back, and got worse during or after other treatment and cannot be treated with other therapies¹

Section.Para: ¹This use is approved under FDA’s Accelerated Approval Program. As a condition of approval, confirmatory trial(s) must show that dostarlimab-gxly provides a clinical benefit in these patients.
Dostarlimab-gxly is also being studied in the treatment of other types of cancer.

Section.Para: Drugs are often studied to find out if they can help treat or prevent conditions other than the ones they are approved for. This patient information sheet applies only to approved uses of the drug. However, much of the information may also apply to unapproved uses that are being studied.
